Create a workspace expense. 2. Add multiple attendees to the expense. 3. Split the expense between attendees. 4. View the expense in the NewDot expense table. ## Expected Result: When an expense is split between multiple attendees, the per-person amount should be clearly displayed in the expense table (e.g., “£11.75 per person”), similar to Classic. Additionally, attendees should eventually be represented in a dedicated column (e.g., avatars in an “Attendees” column), while maintaining a clean and consistent table layout aligned with NewDot design principles. ## Actual Result: The expense table only displays the total amount. The per-person split amount is not shown, making it less clear how much each attendee is responsible for and how category limits apply. ## Workaround: Users can open the expense details page to manually calculate or review the split amounts. Expensify can still be used without this being fixed, but clarity is reduced when reviewing split expenses. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos Proposal from Slack: --- [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Expenses flash yellow highlight repeatedly instead of once

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
r## Bug Description

Slack thread https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1771814813477409

When creating expenses and viewing the Expenses page (Reports > Expenses), newly created expenses flash yellow (highlight animation) correctly on first appearance, but then **flash again repeatedly** on subsequent search result updates. The highlight should only play once per new expense.

## Expected Behavior

Each expense should flash yellow exactly once when it first appears in the Expenses list.

## Actual Behavior

The same expense flashes yellow repeatedly whenever search results are refreshed (e.g., due to Onyx updates, API responses, or other transaction mutations while on the page).

## Root Cause

There is a **race condition** between two cleanup `useEffect`s in `src/hooks/useSearchHighlightAndScroll.ts`, combined with a missing deduplication guard.

### Race condition between Effect A and Effect B

Two effects fire when `newSearchResultKeys` transitions from `null` to a non-null Set:

- **Effect A** (lines 234-258): `requestAnimationFrame` → `setTimeout(300ms)` → clears `transactionIDsToHighlight` in Onyx
- **Effect B** (lines 268-279): `setTimeout(300ms)` → `setNewSearchResultKeys(null)`

**Effect B fires first** (~300ms) because Effect A has an extra `requestAnimationFrame` delay (~16ms). When Effect B fires:

1. `setNewSearchResultKeys(null)` triggers a React re-render
2. Effect A's **cleanup function** runs, calling `clearTimeout(timer)` and `cancelAnimationFrame(animation)` — **this cancels the pending Onyx clear**
3. Effect A re-runs with `newSearchResultKeys === null` and hits the early return at line 236
4. **Result**: `transactionIDsToHighlight` stays `{transactionID: true}` in Onyx permanently (until the user navigates away from the search type)

### Missing deduplication for manual highlights

After the first (correct) highlight, `transactionIDsToHighlight` is never cleared. Then any subsequent change to `searchResults.data` re-fires the "detect new items" effect (line 182). The filter at lines 210-213 **unconditionally returns `true`** for IDs found in `manualHighlightTransactionIDs`, bypassing the `highlightedIDs` deduplication check:

```ts
const newTransactionIDs = currentTransactionIDs.filter((id) => {
    if (manualHighlightTransactionIDs.has(id)) {
        return true;  // <-- Always true, bypasses highlightedIDs check
    }
    // ...
});
```

This causes `newSearchResultKeys` to be set again, and the highlight animation replays. The same cleanup race repeats indefinitely.

## Proposed Fix

**Fix 1 — Eliminate the race condition**: Ensure `transactionIDsToHighlight` is cleared reliably regardless of when `newSearchResultKeys` is reset. For example, clear `transactionIDsToHighlight` immediately when the highlight is consumed in the "detect new items" effect (line 230), rather than in a separate effect with a timer. Alternatively, decouple the two cleanups so Effect A doesn't depend on `newSearchResultKeys` in its dependency array.

**Fix 2 — Add deduplication for manual highlights**: At line 211, also check `highlightedIDs.current.has(id)` before returning `true`:

```ts
if (manualHighlightTransactionIDs.has(id)) {
    return !highlightedIDs.current.has(id);
}
```

## Reproduction Steps

1. Open the Expenses page (Reports > Expenses)
2. Create a new expense using the global create button (e.g., Scan, Manual, Distance)
3. Observe the expense flashes yellow once (correct)
4. Wait for any background data refresh or create another expense
5. Observe the previously created expense flashes yellow again (incorrect)

## Key Files

- `src/hooks/useSearchHighlightAndScroll.ts` — the highlight tracking and cleanup logic
- `src/hooks/useAnimatedHighlightStyle/index.ts` — the yellow flash animation
- `src/libs/actions/IOU/index.ts` (line 1142) — where `transactionIDsToHighlight` is set on expense creation
- `src/libs/actions/Transaction.ts` (line 1545) — `mergeTransactionIdsHighlightOnSearchRoute` Onyx merge function
- `src/components/Search/index.tsx` (lines 1038-1063) — where `shouldAnimateInHighlight` is derived from `newSearchResultKeys`

## Platform

Web, iOS, Android (all platforms using the Expenses search page)

title: [$250] [Performance] Typing in Inbox search freezes JS thread on mobile

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
## Description Typing into the Inbox search (SearchRouter) freezes the JS thread on mobile. The native back gesture and native scrolling still work, but all JS-driven interactions (navigation buttons, virtualization recalculation) become unresponsive. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Open the app on a mobile device (iOS or Android) 2. Tap the search icon in the Inbox 3. Start typing a search query 4. Observe that the UI becomes unresponsive ## Expected Behavior Search input should remain responsive while filtering results, with no perceptible lag or JS thread blocking. ## Actual Behavior The JS thread freezes. Navigation buttons stop working, virtualization bounds don't recalculate. Only native gestures (back swipe, scroll) continue to work. ## Root Cause `autocompleteQueryValue` in `SearchRouter.tsx` updates immediately on every keystroke (only `textInputValue` is debounced). This triggers synchronous re-computation of: - `getSearchOptions()` -- filters all reports/personal details - `isSearchStringMatch()` -- creates RegExp per word per item - `combineOrderingOfReportsAndPersonalDetails()` -- sorts results - Multiple `.filter()` chains on tags, categories, currencies, participants ## Suggested Fixes 1. Debounce `autocompleteQueryValue` (or the prop passed to `SearchAutocompleteList`) so filtering doesn't run on every keystroke 2. Memoize `searchOptions` and `recentReportsOptions` with stable dependencies 3. Optimize `isSearchStringMatch` -- reuse compiled RegExp objects instead of creating new ones per iteration 4. Consider moving heavy filtering off the JS thread (InteractionManager, web worker, or native module) ## Platform - [x] iOS - [x] Android - [ ] Web (likely affected but less severe) ## Reporter Chuck ([Slack thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1771606797669149))
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @aimane-chnaif
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~022025920563596911295
  • Upwork Job ID: 2025920563596911295

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71244 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has a workspace with rules enabled. Prerequisite 2: Taxes enabled and at least two taxes different from default one created. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Navigate to "Workspaces" > "Rules" > "Add Merchant Rule" 3. In "For expenses with", add any merchant. 4. In "Apply these updates", add a category, a description and a tax rate different from default one. 5. Save the rule. 6. Navigate to workspace chat. 7. Create a manual expense with merchant added on step 3. 8. Open the just created expense. 9. Note that a "Set the category to XX, description to XX and tax rate to XX via workspace rules" system-generated message is displayed on report. 10. Tap on "More" > "Add Expense" > "Create Expense" 11. Create a new manual expense with a different merchant and same "Tax Rate". 12. Select the first created expense. 13. Tap on dropdown menu > "Merge" 14. Select the second created expense. 15. Keep all the details from second expense and finish the merging flow. 16. Once redirected to report, edit the "Tax" field and select another tax different from default one. 17. Note that "Workspace Rules" system generated message appears again. ## Expected Result: "Set the tax to XX via workspace rules" system generated message should not be visible if "Tax" field is edited manually. ## Actual Result: "Set the tax to XX via workspace rules" system generated message, is displayed after merging expenses and editing the tax rate manually. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f4a6e1c9-06bd-42ff-b88e-ac9a6252caed [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71244 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.7.3 Chrome, Pixel 5 Android 14 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND 2. Create Workspace 1, enable Taxes, add tax rate 10% 3. Create Workspace 2, Taxes are disabled 4. Add Expense 1 in the workspace 1 chat, select tax rate 10%, rename the report for the convenience 5. Create Expense 2 in the workspace 2 chat 6. Navigate to the Workspace 1 chat, open Expense 1 7. Click More - Merge, select Expense 2 from Workspace 2 8. Select Amount, merchant, category, and report of the Expense 2, click Continue 9. Observe the confirmation page ## Expected Result: In review details step, Tax field does not show , as it's auto selected depending on destination report (https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71244 Test 3 Step 1) ## Actual Result: Tax rate and Tax amount fields are shown on merge confirmation page, when destination WS has no taxes ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2782b2ad-5a78-413e-9a43-7a6095055e73 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71244 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** dreamnitethedragon@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Redminote 10S Android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Launch app 2. Create 2 workspaces *Tax - tax enabled *Non tax - tax not enabled 3. Open non tax workspace chat 4. Create a manual expense entering merchant 5. Open tax enabled workspace 6. Create a manual expense entering merchant 7. Change tax rate to 5% 8. Tap more - merge 9. Select second option in all section in details and continue 10. Tap merge 11. Scroll down and note skeleton is shown in top section 12. Navigate back using top arrow 13. Note skeleton and hmm not here page shown 14. Tap top arrow and note tax workspace chat page is shown 15. Open non tax workspace chat 16. Open the merged expense 17. Scroll down and note changed tax rate system message is shown ## Expected Result: The merged report should load normally without skeleton loader. Navigating back should not show “Hmm, not here”. No tax-related system message should appear in a tax-not-enabled workspace. ## Actual Result: A skeleton loader appears after merge in top section of page when scroll down the page. Navigating back briefly shows skeleton and “Hmm, not here” page. In the tax-not-enabled workspace, the merged expense shows a “Tax rate changed” system message. Note: loading issue in android, system message in web too ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56ca3609-8442-4f94-a8b1-ea851a7592c9 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82679 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Windows 11 / Chrome, Android 13 / Xiaomi Poco F5, iOS 15.8.3 / iPhone 7 Plus **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Preconditions: 1. User A is a new user created on https://staging.expensify.com/ by selecting "Organize my own expenses". The "Get paid back from my employer" option was selected from the intent selector during the onboarding flow. 2. In NewDot, change the default currency to USD 3. Click FAB > Start chat to a non-existent account (User B) > Create an expense via User B's chat Steps: 1. Go to User B's email inbox 2. From the email with the subject "Please pay expense", copy the link "open it in Expensify" 3. Paste to new tab, change the link to staging and navigate to it 4. Go to the expense details 5. Tap on Pay $X.XX > Pay with business account 6. Tap on Log into your bank account 7. Complete the Plaid flow 8. Approve the expense 9. Tap on Pay $X.XX 10. Navigate to the Concierge chat ## Expected Result: Verify that the onboarding tasks are displayed for manage my team expenses ## Actual Result: Wrong onboarding tasks were displayed twice in the Concierge chat Note: - Chat and split expense onboarding task is displayed twice ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8ee47f65-8824-420b-aeea-e8e54c0b36cf [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-5897/folder/13176964/41237741/1203274872 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** emady.syed1234+400@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Realme C21Y / Android 11 **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Precondition: Fresh install the App and login with a new account 1. Open App 2. Background the App 3. Go to other App and tap on link : https://staging.new.expensify.com/r/hellogorgeous 4. Go to other App and tap on link : https://staging.new.expensify.com/r/1234 ## Expected Result: Expensify App should open and Show error message "Hmm... it's not here message in the conversation history" ## Actual Result: User navigates to Home tab Issue occurs when open App and background it regardless of fresh install, but if you open the link when App is completely close then background and open the link again, this issue will not occur. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0dfc6bc1-20b0-4fc1-ba20-ea920179c5c1 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: Bug

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/81514 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** dreamnitethedragon@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Redminote 10S Android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Launch app 2. Create workpace 3. Enable rules 4. Create a rule selecting a category 5. Duplicate the workspace 6. Open the rule 7. Go offline 8. Delete the rule 9. Try to add other rule 10. Note category row is shown 11. Go online 12. Go troubleshoot and clear cache 13. Go to duplicate workspace - rule 14. Tap add merchant rule 15. Note category row is missing 16. Open category page 17. Note Blank state is shown briefly and updated showing category list 18. Now go to rules section and try to add a rule 19. Note category row is shown ## Expected Result: Category row should consistently appear when adding a merchant rule. Clearing cache should not affect whether the category field is visible. Category list should be shown without temporary blank state. ## Actual Result: After deleting a rule offline and clearing cache, the Category row is missing when adding a new merchant rule. Opening the Category page briefly shows a blank state, then loads categories. After categories finish loading, returning to add rule shows the Category row again. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/494eb8c6-8580-4456-ae9e-ec56edb309ef [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/81514 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** dreamnitethedragon@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Redminote 10S Android 13 **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Launch app 2. Create Workspace 3. Enable rules 4. Create a merchant rule selecting a category 5. Go offline 6. Delete the rule 7. Create another rule 8. Delete the rule 9. Duplicate the workspace 10.Open rules 11. Go online 12. Note merchant deleted is cleared 13. Go offline 14. Note merchant deleted is shown in strike through again 15. Go to troubleshoot and clear cache 16. Go to rules 17. Go offline 18. Note now deleted merchant rule is not shown in strike through ## Expected Result: Merchant rules deleted while offline should remain deleted after going online. Deleted rules should not reappear in strike-through state when going offline again. ## Actual Result: Merchant rules deleted while offline initially appear as strike-through (expected pending deletion state). After going online, deleted rules are cleared from the Rules list. When switching back offline, previously deleted rules reappear in strike-through state. Only after clearing cache does the deleted rule stop reappearing offline. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7ed01d19-795d-4f15-bfc4-655c070fa262 View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.24-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82772 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Windows 11, Chrome **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Precondition - User has a workspace with USD currency as default. - User has added a personal card to the account. 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to the WS > Company Cards > Add cards > United States > Direct feed > Other. 3. Add a Wells Fargo bank account and complete it. 4. Return to Company Cards, assign a card to yourself. 5. Navigate to Home ## Expected Result: When company and personal cards are added, they should appear in the Assigned cards widget on Home. ## Actual Result: After adding company and personal cards, they are not displayed in the Assigned cards widget. (only Expensify cards are displayed) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/869ae48d-0d67-492b-a903-12879439fb72 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
